snippet: Alvin K. Hellerstein of Federal District Court in Manhattan said the authorities, seeking to conceal an informant’s identity in a weapons case, didn’t “tell the full truth.”
abstract: Judge Alvin K Hellerstein of Federal District Court in Manhattan says that New York Police Dept officers and agent from Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives provided false testimony in seeking to conceal an informant’s identity in a grand jury trial; lengths to which police and federal agents may have gone to conceal their source has turned seemingly ordinary gun possession case into flash point over legal ethics.
lead_paragraph: Alvin K. Hellerstein of Federal District Court in Manhattan said the authorities, seeking to conceal an informant’s identity in a weapons case, didn’t “tell the full truth.”

headline.main: Judge Says Police and U.S. Agents Misled Court in Manhattan Gun Possession Case
